name: extrusion of plastic sheets and thermoforming, inline | extrusion of plastic sheets and thermoforming, inline | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/13403/documentation

This service activity represents the inline extrusion and thermoforming of plastic pellets for the food industry. That is, it includes all interventions associated with the extrusion AND thermoforming of plastic sheets, inline. The amount of plastic pellets processed is NOT included. The inventory refers to an INPUT of 1 kg of plastic pellets, i.e. all inputs and outputs are expressed per kg of raw materials (excluding internal recycling), i.e., T, where ;t (final product)= 0.94 kg / kg of raw material ;Y ( losses being recycled within the process (=internal recycling), closed loop)=0.29  kg / kg of raw material;t' (losses recycled in external, opened loop)= 0.06  kg / kg of raw material;T (raw materials, exluding internal recycling)=1  kg / kg of raw material;That is, an input of 1 kg of plastic yields 0.94 kg of thermoformed plastic sheets. Losses caused during production that are recycled internally are not accounted for explicitly. However, the additional energy requirements associated with the internally recycled plastic are considered.;In detail, the activity includes: ;- water and energy consumptions;- required auxiliaries such like detergents and solvents;- production infrastructure ;- direct emissions to air (VOC);- wastewater treatment of the used auxiliaries;- end of life of the production wastes incinerated and recycled externally;. In case you want to model this activity with expansion gas (this service activity works without) please add the following exchange flows and numbers, respectively.	                            without expansion	                  with expansion;Butane input	  0	                           0.0595 ;Butane emissions	  0	                  0.0298;;Prepared and submitted by Quantis, financed, supported and followed by Eco-Emballages (Sophie Bonnier, sophie.bonnier@ecoemballages.fr) and Elipso (Vincent Colard, v.colard@elipso.org)

The activity starts with the arrival of the raw materials.

The activity ends with the production of thermoformed plastic container. This process contains the auxiliaries and energy demand for the mentioned conversion process of plastics. The processed amount of plastics is NOT included into the dataset. The packaging of raw materials and final product is not considered within the activity.
category: C:Manufacturing/22:Manufacture of rubber and plastics products/222:Manufacture of plastics products/2220:Manufacture of plastics products

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: information from different French converting companies
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: From the production volume of the two sampled to the production volume of all extrusion-thermoforming inline production facilities in France.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
Survey with on site visit. Represents the production volume weighted average of two companies in France producing more than 3 000 tons /year with this technology covering more than 10% of the production volume of thermoformed packaging produced with an extrusion & thermoforming inline process in France. For one of the two companies n-butane gas is added to expense the plastic.  
Given the fact that around 60 000 tons of thermoformed products are sold in France per year (excluding FFS process that is not considered here), and that the extrusion-thermoforming inline process is less than half of the total production: the data collection captures more than 10% of the total production.

exchanges.description:
Service activity representing the inline extrusion and thermoforming of plastic sheets for the food industry. 
This activity should be used as follows: If an activity requires 1 kg of plastic containers (produced by an inline plastic sheet extrusion and plastic sheet thermoforming process) the user should list (i) 1/0.94 = 1.0638 kg of the service and 1.0638 kg of the plastic type processed.
